results.title: Down to earth
results.creator_credit: Paul Klee, Gilbert Lauzun and A United Nations Productions
results.brief_description: Since the space age began, the U.N. has been concerned with using “outer space” technology for the benefit of the developing, as well as the advanced nations. As examples of peaceful applications of the new technology, the film shows how orbiting satellites bring instructional television to India, survey a rain forest and search the Altiplano for minerals in Bolivia and monitor a typhoon in the Phillippines.

results.title: Doppler principles (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Air Training Command and Dept of the Air Force
results.brief_description: Uses animation to present the phenomenon of the Doppler effect. Explains the effects on a transmitted wave when it encounters a moving object or when the transmitter itself is moving. Also explains the Doppler effect when the target is moving at various angles to the transmitter.

results.title: Don't send your daughter
results.creator_credit: Robin Roger Cook and Audio-Visual Aids, University of Melbourne
results.brief_description: Produced for the Students Representative Council, University of Melbourne, this film summarises the first year of life at the University. It shows new students at the “freshers” camp at Anglesea; the main sections of the University; view of the library and instructions how to use it; scenes at the Cabaret Ball; an Engineering School lecture; sports activities; graduating ceremony; exams.

results.title: Don't push your luck
results.brief_description: A dramatic eye safety film featuring Bill Frank of Chicago, Illinois, a genuine eye accident casualty who re-enacts the events before and after his injury. A variety of typical work situations where eye injuries can occur are shown and impact tests are used to recommend the use of protective eyewear. Some members of the Wise Owls Club show the effectiveness of safety glass in preventing injury.

results.title: Don't give up on me
results.brief_description: A look at the child abuse problem from the desperate parents’ point of view. Barbara, a mother of two small children, is accused of abusive behaviour and in danger of having her baby taken from her by the courts. We see Barbara’s State-assigned case worker, struggling to help the distraught mother come to grips with her problem. An adapted case history which uses scenes from an actual counselling workshop for child abuse parents.

results.title: Doled out
results.brief_description: A film about being unemployed and on the dole in Australia in 1978. In interviews and short dramatised sketches, the causes and effects of unemployment are examined in statements by people who are tired of being called “bludgers”. Suitable for secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Doing business in Japan
results.creator_credit: Business Council for International Understanding and Vision Associates
results.brief_description: This film deals with the difficulties and complications that arise, in international business relationships, as a result of the cultural barriers that exist. The film is designed to be a teaching/training tool that can be used as the focus of a discussion or course of study.
